getTagNames

public java.lang.String[] getTagNames()
Description copied from interface: XMLSessionTagHandler
This method should return an array of String containing the names of the tags for which it wants to be called. This method is only called once upon module initialization.

Specified by:
getTagNames in interface XMLSessionTagHandler

xmlTag

public boolean xmlTag(org.w3c.dom.Element e)
               throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: XMLSessionTagHandler

This is the method that is called when the XML parser has finished and found that the root element (tag) matches one of the names returned by getTagNames().

This method should throw a ParserException if anything goes wrong with the interpretation of the data, or an IOException if there are any I/O-related problems. Throwing any of these will cause the server to terminate and dereference the client.

Specified by:
xmlTag in interface XMLSessionTagHandler
Parameters:
e - The root element ("firstChild") of the XML document received by the parser.
java.io.IOException
